title: 加州橡树岭高中社会学实验课堂

action: Sit quietly at desk and observe classroom
thoughts: First day of this sociology experiment. I should follow the rules carefully and make sure I understand how everything works. The uniforms and flags make this feel very formal. I wonder what the daily pledge will be like.
memory: First day of sociology experiment
Noticed formal classroom setting with flags
Preparing to follow all rules carefully

action: Maintain rigid posture while subtly shaking head in disapproval of the whispering
thoughts: They shouldn't be whispering - the rules are clear and the armband students are watching. I need to distance myself from this rule-breaking behavior to avoid losing points.
memory: Witnessed multiple students breaking no-talking rule
Growing concern about potential collective punishment
Determined to maintain perfect compliance with authority

action: Maintain rigid posture while discreetly observing teacher's reaction to the whispered conversations
thoughts: The whispering continues despite the warnings. I need to stay perfectly still and compliant to avoid any association with rule-breakers. The observation window makes me nervous - they're watching everything.
memory: Cares about rules
Wants social acceptance
Pays attention to authority

action: Maintain rigid posture while discreetly scanning for teacher's reaction to rule violations
thoughts: The teacher must have noticed those whispers. I need to show perfect compliance and distance myself from any rule-breakers. Collective punishment would be unfair to those of us following the rules properly.
